derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from South African Dutch trek (noun), trekken (verb) 'pull, travel'

entry.tran: (通常指徒步)艰难旅行，跋涉，远足
entry.def: If you trek somewhere, you go on a journey across difficult country, usually on foot.

example.ex: This year we're going trekking in Nepal.
example.tran: 今年我们准备去尼泊尔远足。

entry.tran: (通常因疲惫而缓慢勉强地)行进，拖着腿走
entry.def: If you trek somewhere, you go there rather slowly and unwillingly, usually because you are tired.

example.ex: They trekked from shop to shop in search of white knee-length socks.
example.tran: 他们拖着步子从一家商店走到另一家，寻找齐膝的白袜子。

means.word_mean: 1. a journey by ox wagon (especially an organized migration by a group of settlers)
1. journey on foot, especially in the mountains;

sentences.sentence: "We spent the summer trekking in the foothills of the Himalayas"

means.word_mean: 2. make a long and difficult journey;

sentences.sentence: "They trekked towards the North Pole with sleds and skis"
